title: Ellie Goulding looks worse-for-wear after a night out with husband Caspar Jopling
text:
She tied the knot with husband Caspar Jopling in August.

And Ellie Goulding appeared to be embracing life as a newlywed, as she made a bleary-eyed exit from the Mahiki nightclub in London with her husband on Friday.

The singer, 32, looked worse-for-wear as she climbed into a taxi following the outing with her art dealer spouse, 27, after the couple exchanged vows in a lavish York ceremony in August.

Time for bed! Ellie Goulding appeared to be embracing life as a newlywed, as she made a bleary-eyed exit from Mahiki in London with her husband Caspar Jopling on Friday

Ellie was clad in all-black as she climbed into the black cab waiting to take her and Caspar home, following their night out in the capital.

The Starry-Eyed songstress looked ready for bed as she climbed into the taxi following her outing.

Ellie was helped into a car by a male pal following the evening with her husband, after the couple returned from their exotic honeymoon last month.

Ellie's outing comes after she took to social media to share a candid post about her struggles with mental health.

Worn out: The singer looked worse-for-wear as she climbed into a taxi following the outing with her spouse

Cosy: Ellie was clad in all-black as she climbed into the taxi following her raucous night out with her husband

Relaxed: The couple appeared to enjoy their outing together as they headed home together following their wild outing

Low-key: Ellie cut a casual figure in skinny black jeans and suede boots with a sparkling toes as she headed home

Taking to Instagram she wrote: 'Sorry this is a little late, but I really wanted to say something about Mental Health Awareness, for what it's worth. We all have a right to feel what we do, whatever it is, whoever we are.

'Exhilaration, madness, absolutely nothing at all, confusion, chronic sadness... (I can sometimes feel all these things in the space of a few days).

'I am beyond relieved that more light is being shone on the complexity of going from being a touring artist/ performer to going straight back to normality on a regular basis. Thank you to those artists who have spoken so candidly about it lately.

'I know I chose this job but nothing could have prepared me for the ups and downs that come with it.

'I know for sure that a lot of my anxiety has come from what they call “imposter syndrome” not believing in myself enough and thinking that I don't deserve happiness which sometimes results in sabotaging your own success.'

Together: Ellie has been enjoying life as a newlywed after she tied the knot with art dealer Caspar in late August

Mr and Mrs: The couple exchanged vows in an idyllic ceremony in York Minster Cathedral with a star-studded guest list in attendance

'I am beyond relieved that more light is being shone on the complexity of going from being a touring artist/ performer to going straight back to normality on a regular basis. Thank you to those artists who have spoken so candidly about it lately.

'I know I chose this job but nothing could have prepared me for the ups and downs that come with it.

'I know for sure that a lot of my anxiety has come from what they call 'imposter syndrome' not believing in myself enough and thinking that I don't deserve happiness which sometimes results in sabotaging your own success.'

Low-key: The likes of Orlando Bloom, Katy Perry, Sienna Miller and James Blunt, as well as Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie, were all in attendance at the lavish nuptials

Open: Ellie grabbed a quick takeaway to take home with her, which she protectively placed on her lap as she climbed into the taxi

Ellie is currently enjoying life as a newlywed after marrying art dealer Caspar Jopling, 27, in an idyllic ceremony in York Minster Cathedral on August 31.

The likes of Orlando Bloom, Katy Perry, Sienna Miller and James Blunt, as well as Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie, were all in attendance at the lavish nuptials.

The wedding party then let their hair down at a reception hosted at stately home Castle Howard.

The congregation were also treated to an eccentric sermon by John Sentamu, the Archbishop of York, which finished with him uncorking a bottle of prosecco as a symbol of the newlyweds’ ‘exhilarating love’.
description: The singer, 32, looked worse-for-wear as she climbed into a taxi following a raucous night out with art dealer husband at the Mahiki nightclub in London on Friday.
